info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 1:15PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Eagle County through 200 PM MDT... At 115 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Gypsum, or 28 miles northeast of Glenwood Springs, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Eagle County, including the following locations... Burns. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
